title: Alert
description: Keeps users informed of important and sometimes time-sensitive changes

frontMatter.title: Alert
frontMatter.description: Keeps users informed of important and sometimes time-sensitive changes

variations.name: Alert - Expandable
variations.description: For important information that can be collapsed

when_to_use.value: Provide access messages when items aren't available
Respond to user actions with feedback messages
Deliver engagement messages encouraging data entry/updates
Most use cases and static content pages
Sub-alerts creating hierarchy on pages with multiple alerts

when_to_consider_else.value: Use [Alert - Expandable](./alert-expandable) for important page information not responding to user feedback
Use [Additional info](/docs/components/additional-info) for clarifying background information
Don't use alerts as the only page content

behavior.value: Manage focus after dismissal—move focus to next logical location (next heading or main h1)
Prevents keyboard/screen reader users from losing focus
Don't stack alerts one after another
Order multiple alerts by severity (most critical first, ideally at top)
Place alerts within page body near related content

content_considerations.value: Standard Alerts must contain headings. Slim alerts do not require headings.
Use direct, concise, plain language messaging
No other expandable components (like Additional info) within alerts
Acknowledge when issues are system-related, not user-caused
Include educational material when helping resolve errors
Avoid jargon and computer code in messages
Don't overuse notifications—too many overwhelm users
Use an action link when a link is needed—preferred for single, clear call-to-action links
Use correct variations (e.g., Link - Directions for Maps, Telephone component for phone numbers)
Don't use bold text for standard links in alert messages

examples.title: Informational
examples.description: Provides helpful information requiring user attention, not for negative consequences.

examples.title: Warning
examples.description: Warns users about negative consequences or issues that have gone wrong.

examples.title: Error
examples.description: Indicates critical issues, failures, or items needing immediate attention.

examples.title: Slim
examples.description: A condensed variation without headings, useful for immediate feedback and form-specific messaging.
